name: Lost for Words! 13 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"And here's to you, Mrs. ______ 
Jesus loves you more than you will know, wo-wo-wo 
God bless you please, Mrs. ______
Heaven holds a place for those who pray"

So what was the mystery woman's name?
questions.explanation:
Robinson.

	Simon and Garfunkel hit the charts with "Mrs Robinson" in 1968. This song, which featured in the film "The Graduate", was a US #1 peaking at #4 in the UK.Both Paul Simon and Art Garfunkel went on to have solo hits in the 1970s.

questions.text:
"I see the ______ moon arising
I see trouble on the way
I see earthquakes and lightnin'
I see bad times today."

What kind of moon was rising in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
bad.

	"Bad Moon Rising" was a chart-topper for Creedence Clearwater Revival in 1969. CCR were voted "World's Top Group" in a 1970 UK poll.

questions.text:
"Every ______ you take and every move you make 
Every bond you break, every step you take 
I'll be watchin' you"

What word is missing from this Police song?
questions.explanation:
breath.

	The Police topped the US and UK charts with "Every Breath You Take". This 1983 track was written by the band's lead singer Sting, real name Gordon Sumner.The Police won both "Brit" and "Grammy" awards in the 1970s.

questions.text:
"______, ahh honey, honey 
You are my candy girl 
And you've got me wanting you."

Complete the opening lyric of this sweet little ditty?
questions.explanation:
Sugar.

	Theses lyrics come from The Archies song "Sugar Sugar".A hit in 1969, the single topped the charts in both the US and UK. The Archies were a group of animated cartoon characters.

questions.text:
"We didn't start the ______ 
It was always burning 
Since the world's been turning"

For what is the singer refusing to take responsibility?
questions.explanation:
fire.

	"We Didn't Start The Fire", written and sung by Billy Joel, was a hit 1989.A US chart topper this single peaked at #7 in the UK."We Didn't Start The Fire" featured on Billy's "Storm Front" album.

questions.text:
"______ Angel, how I love him
He's got something that I can't resist
But he doesn't even know that I,I,I exist"

Which boy's name fills the gap in this song lyric?
questions.explanation:
Johnny.

	These lyrics come from the 1962 Shelly Fabares hit "Johnny Angel". This song, which features on the album "The Best Of Shelley Fabares", was a US #1, peaking at #41 in the UK.

questions.text:
" ______, I love you
You're the one, the one for me
I'm in love, and I won't lie"

Which girl's name is missing from this Kool and The Gang song lyric?
questions.explanation:
Joanna.

	"Joanna" was a 1984 hit for Kool and The Gang.This single charted at #2 in the UK. Kool and The Gang is a US group from New Jersey.

questions.text:
" ______ Karma's gonna get you
Gonna knock you right on the head"

Just how fast was John Lennon's karma?
questions.explanation:
Instant.

	"Instant Karma" was performed by John Lennon and the Plastic Ono Band. The song peaked at #5 in the UK charts. "Instant Karma" was one of many hits for John Lennon following the split-up of the Beatles.

questions.text:
"______, huh 
What is it good for? 
Absolutely nothing 
Say it again"

So what does Edwin Starr think is good for nothing?
questions.explanation:
War.

	The single "War" was a US chart topper, peaking at #3 in the UK. Edwin Starr had a hit with this Motown track in 1970. "War" was his biggest chart hit - Edwin Starr died in 2003.

questions.text:
"One bad ______ don't spoil the whole bunch, girl 
Oh, give it one more try before you give up on love."

And finally what's gone rotten for the Osmonds?
questions.explanation:
apple.

	"One Bad Apple" was a hit for US group the Osmonds in 1971.The Osmond brothers, Donny, Alan, Wayne, Merrill and Jay hail from Utah.Other family members, sister Marie and younger brother Jimmy, also had solo hit singles.
